description: From water +‎ tight. Compare Scots wattirticht (“watertight”), West Frisian wetterticht (“waterproof”), Dutch waterdicht (“waterproof, watertight”), German wasserdicht (“watertight, waterproof”), Danish vandtæt (“watertight”), Swedish vattentät (“watertight, waterproof”).

adjectives.description: watertight (comparative more watertight, superlative most watertight)

entries.meaning: So tightly made that water cannot enter or escape.
(figurative) So devised or planned as to be impossible to defeat, evade or nullify.
examples: a watertight contract; a watertight regulation
